channel.title: math.OA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.OA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: A Shubin pseudodifferential calculus on asymptotically conic manifolds
item.description: arXiv:2408.08169v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We present a global pseudodifferential calculus on asymptotically conic manifolds that generalizes (anisotropic versions of) Shubin's classical global pseudodifferential calculus on Euclidean space to this class of noncompact manifolds. Fully elliptic operators are shown to be Fredholm in an associated scale of Sobolev spaces, and to have parametrices in the calculus.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Krainer

item.title: Sharp bottom spectrum and scalar curvature rigidity
item.description: arXiv:2408.08245v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove a sharp upper bound for the bottom spectrum of Laplacian on geometrically contractible manifolds with scalar curvature lower bound, and characterize the distribution of scalar curvature when equality holds. Moreover, we prove a scalar curvature rigidity theorem if the manifold is the universal cover of a closed hyperbolic manifold.
item.dc:creator: Jinmin Wang, Bo Zhu

item.title: Homotopy of product systems and K-theory of Cuntz-Nica-Pimsner algebras
item.description: arXiv:1911.00959v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We introduce the notion of a homotopy of product systems, and show that the Cuntz-Nica-Pimsner algebras of homotopic product systems over N^k have isomorphic K-theory. As an application, we give a new proof that the K-theory of a 2-graph C*-algebra is independent of the factorisation rules, and we further show that the K-theory of any twisted k-graph C*-algebra is independent of the twisting 2-cocycle. We also explore applications to K-theory for the C*-algebras of single-vertex k-graphs, reducing the question of whether the $K$-theory is independent of the factorisation rules to a question about path-connectedness of the space of solutions to an equation of Yang-Baxter type.
item.dc:creator: James Fletcher, Elizabeth Gillaspy, Aidan Sims
